title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons have a 3-4 record entering Sunday's game against the Patriots, hoping to ignite a playoff run.
Running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and poses a dual-threat to the Patriots.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed per game, with standout cornerback A.J. Terrell allowing just two touchdowns since 2024.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single in the third inning, giving the Dodgers a 3-0 lead over the Blue Jays.
Kiké Hernandez made a game-saving play by throwing out Addison Barger at second base, sealing the Dodgers' Game 6 win.
The Dodgers' 3-1 victory over Toronto forces a decisive Game 7 in the World Series, with Betts breaking his hitting slump.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff dressed up as Wizard of Oz characters and handed out candy on the T for Halloween.
Boston Police spotted SpongeBob and a future cadet at the Salesians Boys & Girls Club in East Boston.
Boston Medical Center's NICU showcased infants in handmade costumes, including superheroes and Celtics champions.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket sold in Marlborough, Mass. remains unclaimed since the Nov. 20, 2024, drawing.
The ticket was purchased at New Capital Farms Convenience Store on Boston Post Road with winning numbers 16-30-60-62-64, Powerball 25.
The prize expires Nov. 20, and if unclaimed, funds will be distributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married in Salem's Willows Park on Halloween.
The bride wore a black dress and veil for the ceremony, reported by Jay Willet of WBZ.
Justice of the Peace Penny Richards shared their story; the couple enjoyed a week in North Shore.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points on 13-for-19 shooting in a narrow 109-108 victory over the 76ers.
The Celtics have won three consecutive games, reaching a .500 record for the first time this season.
Despite a late 76ers rally, the Celtics maintained their lead, aided by crucial defensive plays in the final seconds.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash for dressing as Jacqueline Kennedy in a bloodied suit for Halloween, calling it a statement.
Jack Schlossberg, Kennedy's grandson, criticized Fox, describing the costume as 'disgusting, desperate and dangerous' on social media.
Fox defended her costume, emphasizing its symbolic representation of trauma, power, and femininity as resistance.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. (knee) and WR Drake London (hip) to play against Patriots in Week 9.
Both players missed Week 8 against Dolphins due to injuries but practiced fully on Friday.
Patriots are on a five-game win streak; Falcons have lost two straight games going into the matchup.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow sees the Red Sox in a strong position to acquire targeted players after their playoff appearance in 2025.
Significant roster challenges include Alex Bregman opting out, and possible contract options for Lucas Giolito and Trevor Story.
The Red Sox have $25 million under the first luxury tax threshold and boast a strong farm system with top prospects.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel introduced individual offensive starters instead of the traditional team introduction before Week 8 victory over the Browns.
Changes in Patriots' traditions, like dropping "Do your job" phrase, occurred under Vrabel's leadership, not due to past burdens.
Patriots lead the AFC East at 6-2 under Vrabel, who focuses on winning and player satisfaction, despite some cultural shifts.
